results.title: J.P.McGowan
results.creator_credit: Scott Murray, Julie Marlow and Paul Kallina
results.brief_description: Born in Terowrie, South Australia, J.P.McGowan acted in more than 270 films, many of which he directed, including the acclaimed serial The Hazards of Helen. The first Australian actor and director to ever break in to Hollywood, his film work is regarded as some of the most skilful of the period, and exists in the hands of several dedicated collectors across the globe. A pioneer Australian film maker, McGowan has left an important international legacy. This half hour film documenting the Terowrie celebration of his life, and illustrating the little known life and career of J.P.McGowan is a marvellous addition to Australian film culture. There is a large extant collection of McGowan’s work, clips from which will be sourced for inclusion in the film. The filmmakers will be in touch with the major collectorof McGowan’s work in Adelaide; and there may be an opportunity to acquire the best of it for ACMI collections

results.title: It's one family: knock on wood
results.creator_credit: Tony De Nonno and De Nonno Pix
results.brief_description: An absorbing look at an Italian-American family who continue to carry on a family tradition of some sixty years of operating a marionette theatre. The family makes and paints the marionettes, which are almost life-sized and extremely heavy, makes the armour and other costumes, operates the marionettes, provides the music and sells the tickets. An excellent example of a traditional Sicilian form of theatre.

results.title: It's easy to criticize
results.brief_description: Deals with the isolation many migrants feel when they are unable to communicate their difficulties and problems to Australians, especially those in authority. To help with these problems they have established their own clubs, where they can share their own language. Recently the New South Wales Government has established the Ethnic Affairs Commission to deal with migrant affairs and welfare.

results.title: It's as easy as selling candy to a baby
results.brief_description: Examines the powerful influence of television in selling sugar-coated snack foods to children. One out of five commercials advertises food or beverage products. As well, medical experts document the health costs of these mesmerising messages to chilren, who as a result of sugar-rich diets, are suffering irreparable damage to their teeth. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: It's all up to you
results.brief_description: This short animated cartoon tells the story of two friends. One eats wisely and remains young and active. The other starts smoking, eats too much and becomes lazy and fat. His foolish way of living leads to a premature death.
results.description: This short animated cartoon tells the story of two friends. One eats wisely and remains young and active. The other starts smoking, eats too much and becomes lazy and fat. His foolish way of living leads to a premature death.

results.title: It's a hobby for Harvey
results.creator_credit: Barry Lank and Barry Lank Productions
results.brief_description: Shows champion whistler Harvey Pollock, a Canadian lawyer by profession, as he performs at regional contests and programs and with the Winnipeg Symphony Orchestra. Pollock’s love of whistling carries over to his personal life as he is seen warbling the strains of classical music at home, in his automobile, on horseback, in the swimming pool, and on his boat.

results.title: Israel: the story of the Jewish people. - Rev. ed.
results.brief_description: Vivid animation portrays Jewish history, beginning with the time of the Patriarchs, including the destruction of the temple and the great dispersion, and concluding with the Nazi persecutions. Taut documentary footage depicts the eventful and tragic years from the Zionist movement in 1900 through the birth of the Jewish nation in 1948. The film’s modern footage presents an objective and forthright description of the progress and problems of Israel today.

results.title: Israel: the 20th century miracle
results.creator_credit: Bob Bailey Studios and R and H Media Productions
results.brief_description: Illustrates how the tiny country of Israel has developed the most efficient and advanced techniques of food production in the world, under the most adverse conditions. Also highlights kibbutz and desert lifestyles.
